result.execSummary:
The defendant Elliot T. Field was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elliot T. Field

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elliot T. Field in court with attorney Eric L Newmark.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 15CF5.  Thorie - plea guilty to felony bail jumping in 15CF5.  Waive preliminary hearing.  Impose time served.   14CF125 will be dismissed.  Newmark in agreement.      15CF5 - Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT
Information if filed with the Court. Defendant waives reading of information.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with defendant.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Count 1 in 15CF5.    Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 1 in 15CF5.  Court dismisses 14CF125.  Thorie addresses court regarding sentencing.  Newmark addresses court regarding sentencing.  Field addresses court regarding sentencing.  Court orders time served.   Appeal rights are given.
Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant
to Reinstate Signature Bond filed by Atty Newmark
from Atty Newmark's office for a continuance on the plea hearing until after the DOC hearing.
from Atty Newmark requesting a contiuance for plea hearing. Plea cannot be entered until Mr Field has a revocation hearing.
from Judge re: Ok Mr. Thorie Agrees.
from Atty Newmark requesting signature bonds be revoked.

3:47 Defendant Elliot T. Field in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears via phone. 14CF125 heard at this time.  Nelson states defendant is on a probation hold. Thorie: quash warrant. Def wants it noted he turned himself in. court reinstates signature bonds in both cases. Court quashes warrants on both cases.  Court: PTC to be set by JA.
Def waives his right to have his preliminary hearing within 20 days.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

4:03 Defendant Elliot T. Field in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court with Def.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Thorie: $1,000 cash bond. Nelson requests a signature bond; Def has been in custody since Dec, currently on DOC supervision. Court does not set a prelim. Sets it for a hearing to be heard with PTC on Def's other case 14CF125  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
